title: [Self-Directed] Integrated Gamification Design Workshop for Strengthening Scientific Inquiry Skills: Deepening Experimentation, Observation, and Variable Control Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design and gamification concepts, foundational knowledge of the scientific inquiry process (experiment design, data analysis, variable control, hypothesis testing)
context.additional_context: Mobile-optimized training for in-service practitioners, implementing smartphone-based microlearning in PC-unavailable environments. Emphasizes applicability in real-life contexts by integrating scientific problem-solving processes with game mechanics. Focuses on replicating scientific inquiry processes (observation/measuring/analysis/conclusion) through game elements.

learning_goals: Learners will design an educational scenario incorporating gamification elements (XP, badges, leaderboards) that reflects the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis→experiment design→data measurement→evidence-based conclusion).

Learners develop three or more microlearning gamification activities applicable in mobile environments (e.g., virtual experiments, simulations for manipulating independent/dependent variables, scientific argumentation quizzes).

Learners establish three or more specific metrics (e.g., participation rate ≥80%, immersion ≥4/5-point scale, knowledge transfer ≥70% accuracy) to evaluate educational effectiveness (engagement, immersion, knowledge delivery) when designing gamification, and create a draft assessment rubric incorporating scientific thinking (systematic observation, logical reasoning, evidence utilization) evaluation criteria.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
